etymologies: late 15th century; earliest use found in Reginald Pecock (c1392–?1459), bishop of Chichester and religious author. From unrecoverable + -ly

definitions: In such a way that no recovery, reparation, or cure is possible; irretrievably; unrectifiably; incurably.

notes.text: Apparently unattested between the late 17th and late 19th centuries.
